name: Basic Command and Control Setup
description: Establish a basic C2 infrastructure using HTTP for communication.

steps.description: Deploy a web server to act as the C2 server.
Configure the malware to communicate with the C2 server.

expected_outcome: Malware successfully checks in with the C2 server at the specified interval.

name: Advanced Persistent Threat Simulation
description: Simulate an APT group's C2 tactics using multiple channels and encrypted communication.

steps.description: Set up a multi-protocol C2 infrastructure.
Deploy encryption mechanisms for C2 communication.
Configure malware with encrypted C2 communication capabilities.

expected_outcome: Malware is able to communicate with the C2 server using multiple protocols with encrypted messages.

name: Evasive Command and Control
description: Create a C2 scenario that is designed to evade detection by blending in with normal traffic.

steps.description: Deploy a C2 server that mimics a social media platform.
Configure malware to use steganography for communication.

expected_outcome: Malware communicates with the C2 server without raising suspicion, as traffic appears to be normal social media activity.
